items.title: Polish AI robotics startup Nomagic raises $44m series B
items.summary:
- Polish robotics startup Nomagic raised US$44 million in a series B funding round.
- The funding aims to expand its market presence beyond Europe into North America.
- The company focuses on AI-driven robotic arms for logistics, planning to enhance technology and business development.
- Funding round led by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), with participation from existing investors like Khosla Ventures and Almaz Capital, and venture debt from the European Investment Bank (EIB).

items.title: DeepSeek offers 75% discounts during off-peak hours
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, introduced off-peak pricing for its AI models.
- Discounts of up to 75% for API usage from 16.30 GMT to 00.30 GMT announced on Feb. 26.
- R1 model API will see a 75% discount, V3 model API will have a 50% discount during the specified times.
- Off-peak hours correspond with standard daytime hours in Europe and the US.
- Recent developments include reopening API access after a suspension and launching new AI solutions.

items.title: Huawei to launch first HarmonyOS Next smartphone in March
items.summary:
- Huawei is set to launch a smartphone in March featuring the HarmonyOS Next platform.
- This is the first device developed specifically for the HarmonyOS Next ecosystem, according to Richard Yu Chengdong.
- Major Chinese tech companies are adapting their applications for compatibility with HarmonyOS Next.
- The announcement was made in a video released on Feb. 24, showcasing advancements in hardware and software.

items.title: Nvidia revenue hits record $130.5b on AI growth in FY 2025
items.summary:
- Nvidia reported Q4 revenue of US$39.3 billion, a 12% increase from the previous quarter and 78% from last year.
- For FY 2025, Nvidia's total revenue reached US$130.5 billion, marking a 114% year-on-year increase.
- GAAP earnings per share rose to US$2.94, representing a 147% increase.
- Data Center revenue hit US$35.6 billion in the quarter, a 16% quarter-over-quarter rise and 93% year-on-year growth, driven by AI technology adoption.
- Several significant developments in February 2025 include competition from DeepSeek and major investments and exits in Nvidia's portfolio.

items.title: Amazon unveils genAI-powered Alexa voice assistant
items.summary:
- Amazon to announce new updates for Alexa on February 27, integrating generative AI for more conversational interaction.
- The internal project named "Banyan" aims to enhance Alexa's functionality, allowing it to process multiple prompts and take actions without direct commands.
- The upgraded version will be available to a limited number of users in the coming weeks and months.

items.title: How Thailand’s big banks shape – and stifle – fintech innovation
items.summary:
- Thailand’s fintech sector lacks unicorns and foreign VC firms, affecting startup growth.
- Chonladet Khemarattana, CEO of the Thai Fintech Association, highlights the corporate venture capital dominance.
- Local fintech firms often cater to banks, limiting their independence and scalability.
- The country’s six largest banks control 82% of loans and deposits, creating a non-competitive environment.
- Three new virtual banking licenses are expected, but big banks lead the contenders.

items.title: Singaporean chip tool maker eyes AI after stock drop
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- ASMPT reported a 94.4% drop in net profit for Q4 2024, totaling HK$4.2 million (US$537,000).
- Revenue remained steady at HK$3.4 billion (US$434 million).
- On Feb. 26, ASMPT’s stock price fell 16.6%, closing at HK$64 (US$8.23).
- CEO Robin Ng cited challenges in non-AI sectors due to a sluggish global economy.
- ASMPT is shifting focus to AI applications to meet the growing demand for AI chips and infrastructure.

items.title: AI component demand drives Taiwan’s industrial growth
items.summary:
- Taiwan's industrial production grew by 5.07% year-on-year in January, fueled by demand for AI electronic components.
- The electronics sector's output surged by 16.67%, with integrated circuits (IC) increasing by 22.92%, reaching a record high.
- Growth attributed to sustained demand from US tech firms for essential AI and high-performance computing chips.
- Non-tech sectors faced declines in basic metals, chemicals, and machinery equipment production.
- The Ministry of Economic Affairs anticipates continued support for the tech sector from AI-driven demand.

items.title: AI education lender Lorien Finance raises $2.25m pre-series A
items.author: Nikhil Mudgal
items.summary:
- Lorien Finance has raised US$2.25 million in a pre-series A funding round.
- Funding led by FlatIronX, with participation from Seedstars International Ventures, Ahimsa Capital, Play Holdings, and others.
- Created a US$3 billion lending pool with over 17 international lenders, interest rates starting at 3.49%.
- Processed funding applications for more than 1,000 students in India since its launch.
- Funding will help expand services to Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities in India, improving access to financing.

items.title: Southeast Asian startups that raised funds over 18 months ago
items.summary:
- Startups with at least 18 months of runway are analyzed for their fundraising history.
- Those listed did their last fundraising round between 18 months and three years ago.
- Scenarios include thriving businesses, reduced burn rates, unannounced funding, or fundraising challenges.
- Listing does not imply the business's current status; it simply reflects the timeframe since the last funding.

items.title: Israeli revenue management platform nets $7m seed
items.author: Erez Agmon, Shenhav Avidar, Shai Gross
items.summary:
- Tel Aviv-based revenue management platform Vayu raised US$7 million in seed funding.
- Investment co-led by Flint Capital and The Garage, with participation from Fresh.Fund and others.
- Funding aims to develop Vayu's platform and expand global market presence.
- Vayu assists B2B companies with complex hybrid pricing models via a no-code automation solution.
- The company processes large-scale data for precise billing.

items.title: South Korean province signs $35b AI data center deal
items.author: Kim Yung-Rok
items.summary:
- Governor Kim Yung-Rok of Jeollanam-do Province signed a US$35 billion AI data center agreement with Fir Hills Inc.
- The agreement was signed in Santa Clara, California, involving collaboration with the local government and landowner.
- Construction is scheduled to begin in winter 2025, with an expected job creation of 10,000 positions in the province.

items.title: Shein threads carefully in Indian return
items.summary:
- Fast-fashion giant Shein has returned to India through a partnership with Reliance Retail, after being banned in 2020 due to data security issues.
- Shein must navigate strong competition from established players like Myntra and Zudio, which already have entrenched supply chains in the country.
- The firm plans to also relocate parts of its supply chain into India, looking to integrate more local manufacturing.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Israel’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Israel's startups over the past year.
- The list is generated based on data highlighting firms that have invested in at least three companies in Israel within the last 12 months.
- The data is constantly updated, aiming to reflect the impact of each firm better as well as the number of deals made by early-stage investors.
- For more detailed information or corrections, readers are encouraged to contact the source.

items.title: AI Pioneer Schmidhuber Supports Saudi Investments
items.author: Jürgen Schmidhuber
items.summary:
- Jürgen Schmidhuber supports Saudi Arabia's AI investments as part of Vision 2030 initiatives.
- He believes these investments are vital for advancing global AI capabilities.
- Schmidhuber acknowledges Saudi Arabia's efforts to establish itself as a tech hub amidst U.S. and Chinese competition.
- He is known for his contributions to deep learning and co-founded the AI startup Nnaisense in 2014.
- Schmidhuber states that AI can address real-world challenges like healthcare and robotics, avoiding dystopian concerns.
- He predicts that smaller, cost-effective AI systems will democratize technology and lessen dependence on large data centers.

items.title: SG’s first laser communication mission to launch in 2026
items.summary:
- Transcelestial to demonstrate Singapore’s first inter-satellite laser communication mission.
- Project supported by the Office for Space Technology and Industry (OSTIn) and ST Engineering.
- High-speed data transfer between satellites using Transcelestial’s laser communication terminals.
- ST Engineering Satellite Systems as the main contractor for satellite design and manufacturing.
- Mission aims for inter-satellite data exchange in Low Earth Orbit by 2026.
- Collaboration to enhance space connectivity and Singapore’s role in the space sector.

items.title: Carousell participates in OpenAI’s Operator preview for AI
items.summary:
- Carousell Group joins OpenAI’s research preview for Operator, an AI agent focused on web-based tasks.
- The initiative aims to enhance user experience for secondhand item transactions.
- Collaboration is in early stages; no specifics on implementation or timeline have been disclosed.
- Carousell has previously utilized AI for personalized recommendations and moderation.

items.title: China criticizes Taiwan for moving chip industry to US
items.summary:
- China accuses Taiwan of transferring its semiconductor industry to the US.
- The claim follows reports about Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) possibly investing in Intel.
- TSMC has not commented on the discussions despite being a major supplier for companies like Apple and Nvidia.

items.title: UK media oppose AI firms using content without license, fee
items.summary:
- British national newspapers published identical front pages on Feb. 25 for the #MakeItFair campaign.
- The initiative addresses proposed changes to copyright laws that may allow AI companies to use creative content without permission or compensation.
- The campaign includes major stakeholders from the creative industry and aligns with the UK government's consultation on copyright law changes.
- Proposed draft would let tech companies use copyrighted materials for training AI unless creators opt out.
- The campaign argues that the changes would favor large tech firms over the creative sectors.

items.title: Lucid CEO Peter Rawlinson steps down
items.summary:
- Peter Rawlinson, CEO of Lucid Group, steps down effective February 25.
- He will transition to a new role as a strategic technical adviser to the chairman.
- COO Marc Winterhoff will act as interim CEO during the search for a permanent replacement.
- Following the news, Lucid's stock increased by 9% in after-hours trading, reaching US$2.85.

items.title: UAE, S Korea partner for AI-powered farming in Abu Dhabi
items.summary:
- UAE's Pure Harvest Smart Farms and Korea's PlanTFarm launched a high-tech farming facility in Al Ain.
- The facility employs AI technologies for controlled environment agriculture (CEA) and reduces water use for animal fodder by 95%.
- The partnership, announced in December 2023, aims to enhance food security in the UAE using vertical farming and greenhouses.

items.title: No more fishy loans after eFishery rout
items.author: Miguel
items.summary:
- The eFishery fiasco may lead banks to adopt more cautious lending practices towards startups.
- Many startups lack collateral and stable cash flows, making it hard for them to obtain loans.
- Despite the eFishery incident, banks might still find benefits in serving startup companies.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s SaaS startups?
items.summary:
- Overview of active investors in Southeast Asia's SaaS startups from the past two years.
- Investors are ranked by the number of deals completed.
- The focus is on firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this timeframe.
- Data is subject to updates, and users can report inaccuracies via email.

items.title: XPeng to launch self-developed chip in May
items.summary:
- XPeng Motors will launch a self-developed chip in May 2025.
- The first vehicle with the chip, known as “F57,” will debut by the end of May.
- The chip, named ‘Turing Chip’, boasts three times the computing power of competitors and is designed for AI applications.
- XPeng plans to equip all new models with the Turing Chip to reduce reliance on Nvidia.

items.title: Apple to launch foldable device in 2026
items.summary:
- Apple plans to launch a foldable device by late 2026.
- Supplier negotiations are scheduled for the second half of 2025.
- It is expected to be a smartphone, with Samsung Display as a key supplier, leveraging experience from Galaxy Z Fold and Z Flip.
- Other suppliers include LG Display, BOE, and LG Innotek for camera modules.
- The launch could significantly impact the supply chain and market.

items.title: Hybrid vehicle registrations in S Korea exceed 2m units
items.summary:
- Hybrid vehicle registrations in South Korea surpassed 2 million for the first time as of Dec. 31, 2024.
- Total registered hybrid vehicles reached 2,024,481, with 482,349 new units added in 2024.
- Growth trajectory includes over 500,000 units in 2019, 1 million in 2022, and 1.5 million in 2023.
- Total eco-friendly vehicles, including electric and hydrogen fuel cell models, reached 2.75 million by end of 2024, accounting for 10.4% of all registered cars.

items.title: Payoneer adds ex-software firm CEO as new board director
items.summary:
- Payoneer has appointed a new board director who is a former CEO of a software firm.
- The appointment aims to strengthen its leadership as it focuses on growth and innovation in the financial services sector.
- This move reflects Payoneer’s strategy to enhance management expertise to better navigate market challenges.

items.title: KKR eyes stake in Starbucks China: sources
items.summary:
- KKR is reportedly considering acquiring a stake in Starbucks China.
- The potential investment comes amid Starbucks' growth in the Chinese market.
- No official statement has been released by KKR or Starbucks regarding this development.

items.title: Axiata doubles profit to $213.9m in FY24 on subsidiary gains
items.summary:
- Axiata Group Berhad reported a profit of 946.8 million ringgit (US$213.85 million) for FY24, more than double compared to the previous year.
- Earnings growth was driven by several subsidiaries despite challenging market conditions; EBITDA grew by 12.3% and EBIT surged by over 100%.
- Revenue rose by 1.9%, largely contributed by subsidiaries like XL Axiata, Edotco, Robi, and Smart, with Link Net and Dialog facing declines.
- Net debt was reduced by 2.6 billion ringgit (US$587.23 million), improving the Net Debt/EBITDA ratio from 3.36x in 2023 to 2.74x.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet buys 135 bitcoins for $12.9m
items.summary:
- Japanese investment firm Metaplanet acquired 135 bitcoins for approximately $12.9 million on Feb. 25.
- The purchase at an average price of $95,951 per bitcoin increases Metaplanet's total holdings to 2,235 BTC.
- The firm aims to reach a total of 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 and 21,000 BTC by 2026.

items.title: India’s Triple Tap Games nets $1.2m pre-seed funding
items.author: Karan Khairajani
items.summary:
- Triple Tap Games, a Mumbai-based gaming studio, raised US$1.2 million in pre-seed funding.
- Funding round led by Eximius Ventures and Kalaari Capital, with contributions from angel investors in entertainment and gaming.
- The funds will support the development of mobile games in the "relax and unwind" category for US and European audiences.
- Founded in 2024 with a focus on hybrid-casual gaming, targeting often overlooked genres.

items.title: Finding Candice: videos, volunteering, and vegetables
items.summary:
- Candice Lee is the creative executive producer and video team lead of Tech in Asia (TIA) Studios.
- Emphasizes the importance of authenticity in video projects, exemplified by a day-in-the-life video for Seek, showcasing an employee’s workday.
- Balances personal health with professional creativity, cooking her own meals and focusing on healthy eating.
- Engages in diverse creative pursuits including writing a fiction novel, investigative journalism, and AI filmmaking.
- Values connections with clients and teammates, believing collaboration enhances project outcomes.
- Ends her day with outdoor activities like sunset hikes, viewing them as vital for mental clarity and inspiration.
- Recently transitioned TIA to the Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) offices, which symbolizes new opportunities and storytelling potential.

items.title: Israeli quantum firm Quantum Machines nets $170m series C
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Quantum Machines raised US$170 million in a series C funding round.
- Total investment for the company reaches US$280 million, valuing it at US$700 million.
- The funding round was led by PSG Equity, with contributions from Intel Capital, Red Dot Capital Partners, TLV Partners, and Battery Ventures.
- Founded in 2018 by former Weizmann Institute researchers, Quantum Machines specializes in technology for various types of quantum computers.
- They have partnered with Nvidia to co-develop DGX Quantum, integrating quantum and classical computations.

items.title: Coupang hits $38b in transaction volume
items.summary:
- Coupang reported a transaction volume of 55 trillion won (US$38.4 billion) in 2024, an increase of 23.6% compared to 2023.
- The company's transaction volume has increased from 33.1 trillion won in 2021 to 38.6 trillion won in 2022.
- Combined, Coupang and Coupang Eats surpassed 60 trillion won (US$42 billion) in 2024, with annual sales projected to exceed 40 trillion won (US$28 billion).
- Q3 2024 revenue rose 32% year-over-year to 10.6 trillion won (US$7.4 billion) and operating profit increased by 29% to 148.1 billion won (US$103.4 million).

items.title: Perplexity launches $50m fund for early-stage startups
items.author: Kelly Graziadei, Joanna Lee Shevelenko
items.summary:
- Perplexity is launching a US$50 million investment fund for early-stage startups.
- The fund will be supported by limited partners and some of the capital from the company's previous fundraising.
- In December 2024, Perplexity raised US$500 million, reaching a valuation of US$9 billion.
- The fund will be managed by Kelly Graziadei and Joanna Lee Shevelenko, founders of F7 Ventures.

items.title: Financial software Intuit’s stock rises after Q2 earnings beat
items.summary:
- Intuit reported revenue of US$3.96 billion in Q2, surpassing expected US$3.83 billion.
- Adjusted earnings were US$3.32 per share, exceeding forecasts of US$2.58.
- Projected Q3 revenue is between US$7.55 billion and US$7.60 billion, above analyst estimates of US$7.51 billion.
- Strong demand for software solutions, particularly AI-driven tools, noted during the US tax season.

items.title: Big Tech unveils major AI, infrastructure investments in US
items.summary:
- Major investments in AI and infrastructure announced by major tech companies in the US.
- Companies involved include leading players in the tech industry aiming to boost technological growth.
- Investments focus on enhancing innovation and building new capabilities in the US market.

items.title: Meta plans $200b AI data centers across the US
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms is considering developing a data center campus for its AI initiatives.
- Estimated costs may exceed $200 billion, as reported by The Information.
- Potential locations include Louisiana, Wyoming, and Texas; Meta executives visited these sites recently.

items.title: Tesla’s market cap drops below $1t as Europe sales drop
items.summary:
- Tesla’s market capitalization falls below US$1 trillion after a decrease in shares for four consecutive sessions.
- The cumulative decline erased US$186 billion in market value.
- The company experienced a 45% drop in car sales in January across Europe, while the regional EV market grew by 37%.
- Analysts cite rising competition and controversies surrounding CEO Elon Musk as key factors affecting sales.
- As of Feb. 25, Tesla shares faced the largest decline among major technology stocks.

items.title: Enterprise HR firm Workday reports 15% revenue growth
items.summary:
- Workday reported a 15% year-over-year revenue increase for the quarter ending Jan. 31.
- Net income declined to US$94 million, or 35 cents per share, down from US$1.19 billion, or US$4.52 per share the previous year.
- The decline was mainly due to a US$1.1 billion tax-related valuation allowance that impacted last year’s results.
- There is a rising demand for Workday's AI tools.

items.title: Warner Bros. closes 3 studios, cancels Wonder Woman game
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery announced the closure of three video game development studios: Player First Games, Warner Bros. Games San Diego, and Monolith Productions.
- The decision, confirmed on Feb. 25, is aimed at improving profitability amid a challenging gaming market.
- Development of Monolith Productions’ “Wonder Woman” game will cease as it no longer fits the company’s strategic priorities despite the goal to create a quality experience for fans.

items.title: Bitcoin drops below $90k as selloff hits crypto market
items.summary:
- Bitcoin dropped to US$86,805 on Feb. 25, the lowest since mid-November.
- The cryptocurrency fell 8.5% in one day, down 20% since Trump's inauguration in January.
- Other cryptocurrencies like ether and XRP also fell, with steep drops recorded.
- Analysts attribute the decline to macroeconomic concerns and new tariffs from the Trump administration.
- Investor sentiment toward Bitcoin ETFs worsened, with significant outflows in February.
- Over US$1.6 billion in leveraged long-position losses occurred within two days.
- A US$1.5 billion hack at Bybit, linked to North Korean hackers, negatively impacted sentiment.

items.title: Intel-backed Ignite launches deeptech accelerator programs
items.summary:
- Intel-backed Ignite Deep Tech has launched updated acceleration programs for deeptech startups at various developmental stages.
- Programs include a flagship initiative for post-seed startups and a pre-seed program, supported by Intel and other partners.
- This follows the closure of Intel’s Ignite startup accelerator six months ago.
- Ignite Deep Tech became independent in December, backed by the Israel Innovation Authority, the Ministry of Economy, and Intel as its first client.
- The new programs aim to expand focus on early-stage deeptech ventures.

items.title: Indian insurtech firm Go Digit invests $3.4m in Dr Reddy’s
items.summary:
- Go Digit acquires a 0.32% stake in Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories for 30 crore rupees (US$3.4 million).
- The transaction is part of Go Digit's standard investment activities, confirmed in a regulatory filing.
- Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories, founded in 1984, specializes in pharmaceuticals including APIs, generics, biosimilars, and custom pharmaceutical services.
- Go Digit, established in 2017, provides digital non-life insurance policies in health, motor vehicle, travel, and property sectors.

items.title: Startup fraud in Asia may be blown out of proportion
items.author: Terence Lee, Queena Wadyanti
items.summary:
- Only 0.21% to 0.47% of startups in India and Southeast Asia faced public fraud allegations in the last five years.
- In comparison, 3% of large publicly traded firms in the US have been exposed for fraud, suggesting startups face far less fraud.
- High-profile fraud cases can give a misleading impression of the prevalence of startup fraud in the regions.
- The majority of known fraud cases are concentrated in a few firms, notably Byju's, which accounts for 75% of reported cases.
- Local investors may benefit from reduced competition for good deals amidst the fraud concerns.

items.title: Pinduoduo hires ex-Baidu experts to build AI models
items.summary:
- Pinduoduo is developing large-scale recommendation models led by a former Baidu AI team member.
- The models focus on price comparison, recommendations, advertising, search, and customer service.
- Pinduoduo has remained low-profile in AI, unlike its competitors.
- Job openings for NLP engineers were posted in November 2023 to explore AI in customer service.

items.title: India’s ePlane partners with Dubai-based Empire Aviation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The ePlane Company has partnered with Empire Aviation Group to deploy eVTOL vehicles in India, UAE, Thailand, and Indonesia.
- This partnership aims to establish urban air mobility solutions, with a focus on safety and fleet management.
- Founded in 2019 by IIT Madras professor Satya Chakravarthy, The ePlane Company is working to reduce traffic congestion with its eVTOL aircraft.
- Significant recent developments include raising $14M for eVTOL development and plans for a full launch of flying taxis by 2026.

items.title: Tumblr backs feed aggregator for the open social web
items.summary:
- Tumblr provides financial support for Tapestry, an app by The Iconfactory that aggregates feeds from RSS, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
- Tapestry, launched in February 2025 with over US$177,000 raised via crowdfunding, plans to develop a native macOS version using Tumblr's funding.
- The backing also funds a new sponsorship program connecting indie advertisers with Tapestry users.
- Tapestry aims to compete with apps like Surf, Feeeed, and Reeder by enhancing content customization and user control.
- Since Automattic's acquisition of Tumblr in 2019, the platform has further integrated with the fediverse, strengthening its position in the open social web.

items.title: CarDekho partners with Raya Holdings to enter UAE market
items.summary:
- CarDekho Group enters UAE market through partnership with Raya Holdings.
- Focuses on the used car market, offering lead management, advertising, and digital solutions.
- Plans to adapt its platform to meet UAE consumer preferences.
- COO Anurag Jain highlights the use of technology to meet regional customer needs.

items.title: Rakuten expands autonomous delivery with advanced robots
items.summary:
- Japan’s Rakuten Group will expand its autonomous delivery service on February 27, featuring advanced robots from US-based Avride.
- The service will cover all of Harumi and parts of Tsukishima and Kachidoki, increasing delivery points to over 90.
- The robots meet Japan’s Robot Delivery Association safety standards and will operate daily from 10:00 am to 9:00 pm with a delivery fee of 100 yen (US$0.67).
